xccdf:Benchmark.xccdf:title: Mozilla FireFox Security Technical Implementation Guide
xccdf:Benchmark.xccdf:description: The Mozilla FireFox Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) is published as a tool to improve the security of Department of Defense (DoD) information systems. Comments or proposed revisions to this document should be sent via e-mail to the following address: disa.stig_spt@mail.mil

xccdf:Profile.xccdf:title: CAT I Only
xccdf:Profile.xccdf:description: This profile only includes rules that are Severity Category I.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: FireFox is configured to ask which certificate to present to a web site when a certificate is required.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>When a web site asks for a certificate for user authentication, Firefox must be configured to have the user choose which certificate to present. Websites within DOD require user authentication for access which increases security for DoD information. Access will be denied to the user if certificate management is not configured.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Set the value of "security.default_personal_cert" to "Ask Every Time". Use the Mozilla.cfg file to lock the preference so users cannot change it.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Network shell protocol is enabled in FireFox.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Although current versions of Firefox have this set to disabled by default, use of this option can be harmful. This would allow the browser to access the Windows shell. This could allow access to the underlying system. This check verifies that the default setting has not been changed. </VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Procedure: Set the value of "network.protocol-handler.external.shell" to "false" and lock using the Mozilla.cfg file.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Firefox is not configured to prompt a user before downloading and opening required file types.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>New file types cannot be added directly to the helper applications or plugins listing. Files with these extensions will not be allowed to use Firefox publicly available plugins and extensions to open. The application will be configured to open these files using external applications only. After a helper application or save to disk download action has been set, that action will be taken automatically for those types of files. When the user receives a dialog box asking if you want to save the file or open it with a specified application, this indicates that a plugin does not exist. The user has not previously selected a download action or helper application to automatically use for that type of file. When prompted, if the user checks the option to Do this automatically for files like this from now on, then an entry will appear for that type of file in the plugins listing and this file type is automatically opened in the future. This can be a security issue. New file types cannot be added directly to the Application plugin listing. </VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Ensure the following extensions are not automatically opened by Firefox without user confirmation. Do not use plugins and add-ons to open these files. Use the "plugin.default_plugin_disabled" preference to set and lock the following extensions so that an external application rather than an add-on or plugin will not be used: PDF, FDF, XFDF, LSL, LSO, LSS, IQY, RQY, XLK, XLS, XLT, POT, PPS, PPT, DOS, DOT, WKS, BAT, PS, EPS, WCH, WCM, WB1, WB3, RTF, DOC, MDB, MDE, WBK, WB1, WCH, WCM, AD, ADP.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Firefox formfill assistance option is disabled.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>In order to protect privacy and sensitive data, Firefox provides the ability to configure Firefox such that data entered into forms is not saved. This mitigates the risk of a website gleaning private information from prefilled information.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Ensure the preference “browser.formfill.enable" is set and locked to the value of “False”.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Firefox is configured to autofill passwords.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>While on the internet, it may be possible for an attacker to view the saved password files and gain access to the user's accounts on various hosts. </VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Ensure the preference "signon.autofillForms" is set and locked to the value of “False”.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: FireFox is configured to use a password store with or without a master password.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Firefox can be set to store passwords for sites visited by the user. These individual passwords are stored in a file and can be protected by a master password. Autofill of the password can then be enabled when the site is visited. This feature could also be used to autofill the certificate pin which could lead to compromise of DoD information.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Ensure the preference “signon.rememberSignons“ is set and locked to the value of “false”.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: FireFox is not configured to block pop-up windows.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Popup windows may be used to launch an attack within a new browser window with altered settings. This setting blocks popup windows created while the page is loading.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Ensure the preference "dom.disable_window_open_feature.status " is set and locked to the value of “true”.

xccdf:Group.xccdf:title: DTBF181 - JavaScript move or resize windows

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: FireFox is configured to allow JavaScript to move or resize windows.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>JavaScript can make changes to the browser’s appearance. This activity can help disguise an attack taking place in a minimized background window. Set browser setting to prevent scripts on visited websites from moving and resizing browser windows. </VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Ensure the preference "dom.disable_window_move_resize" is set and locked to the value of “true”.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Firefox must be configured to allow only TLS.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Use of versions prior to TLS 1.1 are not permitted. SSL 2.0 and SSL 3.0 contain a number of security flaws. These versions must be disabled in compliance with the Network Infrastructure and Secure Remote Computing STIGs.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext:
Configure the following parameters using the Mozilla.cfg file:
LockPref "security.enable_tls" is set to "true". LockPref "security.tls.version.min" is set to "2". LockPref "security.tls.version.max" is set to "3".

xccdf:Group.xccdf:title: DTBF182 - JavaScript raise or lower windows

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Firefox is configured to allow JavaScript to raise or lower windows.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>JavaScript can make changes to the browser’s appearance. Allowing a website to use JavaScript to raise and lower browser windows may disguise an attack. Browser windows may not be set as active via JavaScript. </VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Ensure the preference "dom.disable_window_flip" is set and locked to the value of “true”.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Firefox is configured to allow JavaScript to disable or replace context menus.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>A context menu (also known as a pop-up menu) is often used in a graphical user interface (GUI) and appears upon user interaction (e.g., a right mouse click). A context menu offers a limited set of choices that are available in the current state, or context, of the operating system or application. A website may execute JavaScript that can make changes to these context menus. This can help disguise an attack. Set this preference to "false" so that webpages will not be able to affect the context menu event.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Ensure the preferences "dom.event.contextmenu.enabled" is set and locked to "false".

xccdf:Group.xccdf:title: DTBF184 - JavaScript hiding or changing status bar

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Firefox is configured to allow JavaScript to hide or change the status bar.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>When a user visits some webpages, JavaScript can hide or make changes to the browser’s appearance to hide unauthorized activity. This activity can help disguise an attack taking place in a minimized background window. Determines whether the text in the browser status bar may be set by JavaScript. Set and lock to True (default in Firefox) so that JavaScript access to preference settings for is disabled.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Ensure the preference "dom.disable_window_status_change" is set and locked to the value of “true”.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Firefox is not configured to provide warnings when a user switches from a secure (SSL-enabled) to a non-secure page.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Users may not be aware that the information being viewed under secure conditions in a previous page are not currently being viewed under the same security settings. </VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Ensure the preference “security.warn_leaving_secure" is set to “true” and locked on this setting.

xccdf:Group.xccdf:title: DTBF003 - Installed version of Firefox not supported

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Installed version of Firefox unsupported.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Use of versions of an application which are not supported by the vendor are not permitted. Vendors respond to security flaws with updates and patches. These updates are not available for unsupported version which can leave the application vulnerable to attack.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Upgrade the version of the browser to an approved version by obtaining software from the vendor or other trusted source.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Firefox automatically updates installed add-ons and plugins.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Set this to false to disable checking for updated versions of the Extensions/Themes. Automatic updates from untrusted sites puts the enclave at risk of attack and may override security settings.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Set the preference “extensions.update.enabled” value to "false" and lock using the Mozilla.cfg file.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Firefox required security preferences cannot be changed by user.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Locked settings prevent users from accessing about:config and changing the security settings set by the system administrator. Locked settings should be placed in the mozilla.cfg file. The mozilla.cfg file is an encoded file of JavaScript commands. The encoding is a simple "byte-shifting" with an offset of 13 (Netscape 4 used a similar encoding, but with a 7 instead). This file also needs to be "called" from the configuration file local-settings.js</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Ensure the required settings in "about:config" are locked using the "mozilla.cfg" file.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Firefox automatically checks for updated version of installed Search plugins.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>Updates need to be controlled and installed from authorized and trusted servers. This setting overrides a number of other settings which may direct the application to access external URLs.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls>ECSC-1</IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Ensure the preference "browser.search.update" is set and locked to the value of “False”.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Extensions install must be disabled.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>A browser extension is a program that has been installed into the browser which adds functionality to it. Where a plug-in interacts only with a web page and usually a third party external application (Flash, Adobe Reader) an extension interacts with the browser program itself. Extensions are not embedded in web pages and must be downloaded and installed in order to work. Extensions allow browsers to avoid restrictions which apply to web pages. For example, a Chrome extension can be written to combine data from multiple domains and present it when a certain page is accessed which can be considered Cross Site Scripting. If a browser is configured to allow unrestricted use of extension then plug-ins can be loaded and installed from malicious sources and used on the browser. </VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility>System Administrator</Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Set the preference “xpinstall.enabled” to “false” and lock using the “mozilla.cfg” file. The “mozilla.cfg” file may need to be created if it does not already exist.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Background submission of information to Mozilla must be disabled.
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: <VulnDiscussion>There should be no background submission of technical and other information from DoD computers to Mozilla with portions posted publically.</VulnDiscussion><FalsePositives></FalsePositives><FalseNegatives></FalseNegatives><Documentable>false</Documentable><Mitigations></Mitigations><SeverityOverrideGuidance></SeverityOverrideGuidance><PotentialImpacts></PotentialImpacts><ThirdPartyTools></ThirdPartyTools><MitigationControl></MitigationControl><Responsibility></Responsibility><IAControls></IAControls>
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:fixtext: Ensure the preferences "datareporting.policy.dataSubmissionEnabled" is set and locked to "false". Ensure the preferences "datareporting.healthreport.service.enabled" is set and locked to "false". Ensure the preferences "datareporting.healthreport.uploadEnabled" is set and locked to "false".

metadata.title: FireFox is configured to ask which certificate to present to a web site when a certificate is required.
metadata.description: FireFox is configured to ask which certificate to present to a web site when a certificate is required.

extend_definition.comment: Mozilla Firefox is configured to read mozilla.cfg file to lock settings.

criterion.comment: Verify 'security.default_personal_cert' is set to 'Ask Every Time' and is locked to prevent the user from altering.

metadata.title: Network shell protocol is enabled in FireFox.
metadata.description: Network shell protocol is enabled in FireFox.

extend_definition.comment: Mozilla Firefox is configured to read mozilla.cfg file to lock settings.

criterion.comment: If the value of 'network.protocol-handler.external.shell' is not 'false' or is not locked, then this is a finding.

metadata.title: Firefox not configured to prompt user before download and opening for required file types.
metadata.description: Firefox not configured to prompt user before download and opening for required file types.

extend_definition.comment: Mozilla Firefox is configured to read mozilla.cfg file to lock settings.

criterion.comment: Criteria: If the 'plugin.default_plugin_disabled' value is not set to false.

metadata.title: Firefox formfill assistance option is disabled.
metadata.description: Firefox formfill assistance option is disabled.

extend_definition.comment: Mozilla Firefox is configured to read mozilla.cfg file to lock settings.

criterion.comment: Verify that the preference name browser.formfill.enable is set to false and locked.

metadata.title: Firefox is configured to autofill passwords.
metadata.description: Firefox is configured to autofill passwords.

extend_definition.comment: Mozilla Firefox is configured to read mozilla.cfg file to lock settings.

criterion.comment: Verify that the preference name 'signon.autofillForms' is set to 'false' and locked.

metadata.title: FireFox is configured to use a password store with or without a master password.
metadata.description: FireFox is configured to use a password store with or without a master password.

extend_definition.comment: Mozilla Firefox is configured to read mozilla.cfg file to lock settings.

criterion.comment: Verify that the preference name 'signon.rememberSignons' is set and locked to 'false'

metadata.title: FireFox is not configured to block pop-up windows.
metadata.description: FireFox is not configured to block pop-up windows.

extend_definition.comment: Mozilla Firefox is configured to read mozilla.cfg file to lock settings.

criterion.comment: Verify that the preference name 'dom.disable_window_open_feature.status' is set to 'true' and locked.

metadata.title: FireFox is configured to allow JavaScript to move or resize windows.
metadata.description: FireFox is configured to allow JavaScript to move or resize windows.

extend_definition.comment: Mozilla Firefox is configured to read mozilla.cfg file to lock settings.

criterion.comment: Verify that the preference name 'dom.disable_window_move_resize' is set and locked to 'true'.

metadata.title: Firefox must be configured to allow only TLS.
metadata.description: Firefox must be configured to allow only TLS.

extend_definition.comment: Mozilla Firefox is configured to read mozilla.cfg file to lock settings.

criterion.comment: Verify Preference Name 'security.enable_tls' is set to the value 'true' and locked.
Verify Preference Name 'security.tls.version.min' is set to the value '2' and locked.
Verify Preference Name 'security.tls.version.max' is set to the value '3' and locked.

metadata.title: Firefox is configured to allow JavaScript to raise or lower windows.
metadata.description: Firefox is configured to allow JavaScript to raise or lower windows.

extend_definition.comment: Mozilla Firefox is configured to read mozilla.cfg file to lock settings.

criterion.comment: Verify that the preference name 'dom.disable_window_flip' is set and locked to 'true'.

metadata.title: Firefox is configured to allow JavaScript to disable or replace context menus.
metadata.description: Firefox is configured to allow JavaScript to disable or replace context menus.

extend_definition.comment: Mozilla Firefox is configured to read mozilla.cfg file to lock settings.

criterion.comment: Verify that the preferences 'dom.event.contextmenu.enabled' is set and locked to 'false'.

metadata.title: Firefox is configured to allow JavaScript to hide or change the status bar.
metadata.description: Firefox is configured to allow JavaScript to hide or change the status bar.

extend_definition.comment: Mozilla Firefox is configured to read mozilla.cfg file to lock settings.

criterion.comment: Verify that the preference 'dom.disable_window_status_change' is set and locked to 'true'.

metadata.title: Firefox is not configured to provide warnings when a user switches from a secure (SSL-enabled) to a non-secure page.
metadata.description: Firefox is not configured to provide warnings when a user switches from a secure (SSL-enabled) to a non-secure page.

extend_definition.comment: Mozilla Firefox is configured to read mozilla.cfg file to lock settings.

criterion.comment: Verify that the preference name 'security.warn_leaving_secure' is set to 'true' and locked.

metadata.title: Installed version of Firefox unsupported.
metadata.description: Installed version of Firefox unsupported.

criterion.comment: Verify there is only one installation of Mozilla Firefox

criteria.comment: IF ESR firefox exists THEN determine whether its version is less than 45.7.0.

criterion.comment: ESR firefox.exe exists.
Verify that firefox.exe version, if running ESR, is not less than 45.7.0).

metadata.title: Firefox automatically updates installed add-ons and plugins.
metadata.description: Firefox automatically updates installed add-ons and plugins.

extend_definition.comment: Mozilla Firefox is configured to read mozilla.cfg file to lock settings.

criterion.comment: Verify the preference 'extensions.update.enabled' is set to 'false' and locked.

metadata.title: Firefox required security preferences cannot be changed by user.
metadata.description: Firefox required security preferences cannot be changed by user.

criterion.comment: Verify there is only one installation of Mozilla Firefox
Verify 'local-settings.js' references mozilla.cfg to lock settings defined in mozilla.cfg
Verify the 'mozilla.cfg' file starts with two forward slashes //
Verify that local-settings.cfg sets general.config.obscure_value to 0

metadata.title: Firefox automatically checks for updated version of installed Search plugins.
metadata.description: Firefox automatically checks for updated version of installed Search plugins.

extend_definition.comment: Mozilla Firefox is configured to read mozilla.cfg file to lock settings.

criterion.comment: Verify the preference 'browser.search.update' is set to 'false' and locked.

metadata.title: Background submission of information to Mozilla must be disabled.
metadata.description: Background submission of information to Mozilla must be disabled.

extend_definition.comment: Mozilla Firefox is configured to read mozilla.cfg file to lock settings.

criterion.comment: Verify that the preferences 'datareporting.policy.dataSubmissionEnabled' is set and locked to 'false'.
Verify that the preferences 'datareporting.healthreport.service.enabled' is set and locked to 'false'.
Verify that the preferences 'datareporting.healthreport.uploadEnabled' is set and locked to 'false'.

metadata.title: Firefox is configured to disable extension installs.
metadata.description: Firefox is configured to disable extension installs.

extend_definition.comment: Mozilla Firefox is configured to read mozilla.cfg file to lock settings.

criterion.comment: Verify that the preference name 'xpinstall.enabled' is set to 'false' and locked.

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Check if local-settings.js exists and points to mozilla.cfg to lock security settings
check if the mozilla.cfg file starts with two forward slashes //

variable_test.comment: Check if there are multiple installations of firefox.

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Check if local-settings.js exists and sets general.config.obscure_value to 0
Check if 'security.default_personal_cert' is set to 'Ask Every Time' and locked.
Check if 'network.protocol-handler.external.shell' is set to 'false' and locked.

Check if 'plugin.disable_full_page_plugin_for_types' value is not set to include the following external extensions and not locked, then this is a finding:PDF, FDF, XFDF, LSL, LSO, LSS, IQY, RQY, XLK, XLS, XLT, POT PPS, PPT, DOS, DOT, WKS, BAT, PS, EPS, WCH, WCM, WB1, WB3, RTF, DOC, MDB, MDE, WBK, WB1, WCH, WCM, AD, ADP.
Check if 'browser.formfill.enable' is set to 'false' and locked.
Check 'signon.autofillForms' is set to 'false' and locked.
Check if 'signon.rememberSignons' is set 'false and locked.
Check if 'dom.disable_window_open_feature.status' is set to 'true' and locked
Check if dom.disable_window_move_resize' is set and locked to 'true'
Check if 'security.enable_tls' is set to the value 'true'
Check if 'security.tls.version.min' is set to the value 2
Check if 'security.tls.version.max' is set to the value 3
Check if that the preference name 'dom.disable_window_flip' is set and locked to 'true'.
Check if 'dom.event.contextmenu.enabled' is set and locked to 'false'
Check if 'dom.disable_window_status_change' is set and locked to 'true'.
Check if 'security.warn_leaving_secure' is set to 'true' and locked

file_test.comment: Check if firefox.exe version is less 45.7.x (ESR only).

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Check if 'extensions.update.enabled' is set to 'false'.
Check if 'browser.search.update' is set to 'false'
Check if 'datareporting.policy.dataSubmissionEnabled' is set and locked to 'false
Check if 'datareporting.healthreport.service.enabled' is set and locked to 'false
Check if 'datareporting.healthreport.uploadEnabled' is set and locked to 'false
Check 'xpinstall.enabled' is set to 'false' and locked.

registry_object.comment: Firefox install directory (64 or 32 bit installations) ESR
registry_object.name: InstallLocation

variable_state.comment: Check to see if there are multiple installations of Firefox

textfilecontent54_state.comment: check for a list of application file types
check string to be equal to 'true'
check string to be equal to 'false'

local_variable.comment: A count of the installation paths of firefox on this computer

metadata.title: Mozilla Firefox Installed
metadata.description: A recent version of Mozilla Firefox is installed.

criterion.comment: 64-bit Mozilla Firefox is installed
32-bit Mozilla Firefox is installed
64-bit Mozilla Firefox is a recent version
32-bit Mozilla Firefox is a recent version

registry_test.comment: 64-bit Mozilla Firefox is a recent version
32-bit Mozilla Firefox is a recent version

registry_state.comment: The registry key exists and is 33 or greater, per the Mozilla Firefox STIG Overview
The registry key exists and is 'Mozilla Firefox'.
